desc: GATA2 encodes the GATA binding protein 2 transcription factor. GATA2 is involved in hematopoiesis and differentiation, including stem cell maintenance and cell specification (PMID:8078582, 12433372, 25578878, 20887958). It is also involved in angiogenesis and lymphangiogenesis (PMID:23892628). Inherited GATA2 mutations are associated with familial myelodysplastic syndrome and acute myeloid leukemia (AML) (PMID:21892162). Mutations are also associated with a heritable lymphedema disorder, Emberger syndrome, with a disposition to AML (PMID:21892158). It is also found in patients with MonoMAC syndrome, an immunodeficiency disorder predisposed to select infectious agents (PMID:21670465). Somatic GATA2 mutations are found in leukemias and often co-occur with CEBPA mutations (PMID:23634996,22649106, 23521373,18250304). Inversion 3 leukemias involve dysregulation of GATA2 and EV1 by translocation of a GATA2 enhancer that regulates gene expression (PMID:24703711). In lung cancer, GATA2 was shown to regulate Ras signaling (PMID:22541434). In prostate cancer and other tumors, GATA2 can promote resistance and metastasis (PMID:25670080, 24448395, 25707769).

desc: GATA2 encodes a transcription factor involved in red blood cell and platelet development. Germline mutations of GATA2 are associated with Emberger and MonoMAC syndromes and predispose to leukemias.
